responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Argument injection in abuild-rmtemp
    analysis: |
      The abuild-rmtemp binary is setuid root and designed to be invoked via abuild-sudo. However, abuild-sudo doesn't perform any sanitization of its command line arguments before execv-ing abuild-rmtemp.
      As such, it may be possible to craft a path that will cause abuild-rmtemp to remove files outside of the allowed directory.
    cwe: CWE-77
    function_names:
      - main
    filenames:
      - abuild-rmtemp.c
    classification: slightly promising
  - headline: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
    analysis: |
      The function `buf_add_ext_header_hexdump` in `abuild-tar.c` takes a `value` argument and directly embeds it into a string without any sanitization using `snprintf`.
      If an attacker can control the content of the `value` argument, they could inject arbitrary HTML and JavaScript code into the generated web page, leading to cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities.
    cwe: CWE-79
    function_names:
      - buf_add_ext_header_hexdump
    filenames:
      - abuild-tar.c
    classification: slightly promising
```

leads.headline: Argument injection in abuild-rmtemp
leads.analysis:
The abuild-rmtemp binary is setuid root and designed to be invoked via abuild-sudo. However, abuild-sudo doesn't perform any sanitization of its command line arguments before execv-ing abuild-rmtemp.
As such, it may be possible to craft a path that will cause abuild-rmtemp to remove files outside of the allowed directory.

leads.headline: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
leads.analysis:
The function buf_add_ext_header_hexdump in abuild-tar.c takes a value argument and directly embeds it into a string without any sanitization using snprintf.
If an attacker can control the content of the value argument, they could inject arbitrary HTML and JavaScript code into the generated web page, leading to cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities.
